course.subject: ISDN
course.name: Sketching
course.description: This course focuses on developing the skills to generate, visualize and define design concepts in 2-D and 3D in both paper and digital formats. Topics covered include freehand sketching on paper, freehand sketching on mobile devices, illustrating the basics of perspective and orthogonal drawing, storyboarding, and visual communication. Students will develop skills in sketching both organic as well as geometric forms.

reviews.author: Abhijith
reviews.title: Take this course ONLY if u want to visualize a lot and kill time
reviews.comment_content: The course is well designed and most importantly, well intended. And you'll end up drawing about 500 sketches, big and small, by the end of this course. So, get a fat sketch book before hand. You'll mostly draw by hand using a regular pencil. You'll also use color pencils at the end.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brian is an artist so, he has the mindset of an artist. If your drawing is shitty, he'll still have some advise for you. If not for the grades, you'll never get penalized in this course ğŸ˜‚. Don't know if that's a good thing tho ğŸ¤”.
reviews.comment_grading: I never got my grades during the duration of the course, nor did I ever see the scores in the canvas. So, don't bother about them and just do what you're supposed to do, as best as you can.
reviews.comment_workload: There's a ton of workload. And I really mean it. All the other courses I took that term, totalling to 15 credits combined, had half the work. If I didn't take the course for that 1 credit, I would've breezed through the fall term. If I drew like a toddler after all that happened, I regret taking this course. I have attached some of my drawings to this review.

reviews.author: heolc
reviews.title: enjoy ISDers its a required course
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is pretty well organized since it tackles most of the drawing skills needed for designers. And we learned how to draw 3d shapes, human figures, buildings, hands, random objects from daily lives, etc. They were all helpful in practicing drawing skills. Only thing that could be better improved is the quality of jpg files uploaded on canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is a skilled designer. He demonstrated the drawing in front of the class with some explanation and we had to copy his doing. The demonstration is not in detail but rather brief. However it was ok since the class was small and he roamed around to help students in need during the whole class. I guess this is 'learning by doing'. If he gave us a detailed explanation and guide I might have slept through class. So I preferred his way of teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: I personally enjoyed the class, barely was absent, and practiced most of the content given via canvas on my sketchbook. There were two(?) sketchbook check and one final exam as I remember. The exam was drawing 3d objects. It required perception of space and critical reasoning. The time was quite tight cause for me there were much to express and develop.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload of this course is more than a typical 1 credit course. More than that most people would predict it to be. However it isn't thaaat much as other reviews mentioned. Still manageable if you maximize the use of your time in class.

reviews.author: Shal2111
reviews.title: Sketching for Beginners
reviews.comment_content: This is a beginner friendly course. You start by drawing lines and simple sketches and move on to more difficult sketches. All aspects of sketching are explained to you, so even if you are not artistic it will be easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brian is great at explaining how to sketch, and will teach you again fi you ask him to. Don't hesitate to ask him for help.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading for this course was vague. They asked us to sketch some chairs for our final assignment. As for the rest, depends on your classwork and homework quality.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is high and Workload is reflect in your grade. The more effort you put in, the higher your grade will be. Brian will look at your entire sketchbook at the end of the semester so make sure you keep up with the homework as well.

reviews.author: â €
reviews.title: Good luck if you don't have background
reviews.comment_content:
Frankly speaking, the course packs a lot of content. It ranges from usage of muscles, lines, shading, shapes, brainstorming, hands, bodies, etc. Tons of examples and Brian is a really skilled artist as well.

Attached please find the syllabus. Though this is for reference only.

However, the amount of content is overly ambitious for the time available, leaving people with no background slipping and struggling to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Brian adopts an interactive approach, involving fun chats between him and you. But unfortunately not effective in helping beginners.
IF you do not have background in sketching, you may face the following issue:
- Stagnation in improvement
- Confusion
- Frustration
- Discouragement

But if you already have background you would have a blast attending the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
[Standard message regarding ISDN] As ISDN is a small subject, the mean of grades will be higher but the standard deviation will be smaller. If you aim for B's ISDN will be great as you need to pay less effort, but if you aim for A+'s go somewhere else or get ready to chase for nothing (some courses don't have A+ because instructors believe there are always room for improvement).

Grading scheme is not very transparent and the final score relies on his impressions of the sketchbook inspection and final quiz.

NOTE: The myth that grading is base on degree of improvement is entirely false as people with years of sketching experience get by with A's and people with no experience may only get a B.

I got a B-. Luckily not C (only one or two Cs, those people really do nothing).

Though it only weights 1 credit, it marks the difference of 0.1 TGA. If only grading is really based on degree of improvement, I would be a lot happier.
Do not let 1 credit deceive you. It still has a solid impact. And I got impacted.
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy workload which will be invisible to you until the last because of no strict deadlines, but I guess this is better than having deadlines, then I will not submit homeworks altogether as I know the time is not worth it to be used this way.  

Each lesson assigns sketching tasks to you. Not checked until the last lesson. You risk further struggles to catch up if you skip the last task as each lesson builds on top of the previous lesson .

reviews.author: Borong
reviews.title: è¿œç¦»1004, If you are not a ISD student, do NOT enroll!!!
reviews.comment_content:

This class teaches sketches related to design, roughly divided into three sections: basics of sketching, design, and human body-related sketching. The content is relatively reasonable, but I don't think I will use this skill later.

ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªæœˆçš„æ•™å­¦å†…å®¹è¿˜ä¸é”™ï¼Œä¹‹ååŸºæœ¬éƒ½æ˜¯è‡ªè¡Œç»ƒä¹ ã€‚Brianå’ŒAronæ•™å¾—æŒºå¥½çš„ï¼Œä½†è¿™å–å†³äºä½ æ€ä¹ˆå¬ã€‚
The teaching content in the first month was not bad, but in the rest of the term, you need to spend most of your time practicing. Brian and Aron teach pretty well, but it depends on how you listen.

The work is difficult and heavy. Although Brian doesn't set a due, don't think about ignoring homework, because he will collect everyone's sketchbooks at the end of the term.

reviews.author: ZanDas
reviews.title: Good course, but be careful to the workload
reviews.comment_content:
This course is made for those who have no previous sketching experiences before but still want to learn the fundametals of sketching. Therefore, dont expect that you would become a sketching master after this course.

1. Drawing lines and building up line quality
2. Building shapes
3. Building boxes and different objects with the aid of the boxes
4. Methods of rapidly generating design ideas
5. Building simple human figures
reviews.comment_teaching: As long as you follow the instuction of the instructor, you can basically express your ideas clearly with the  others in terms of a sketch. There isnt much teaching, but more practicing in this course. Most of the time brian would just give you some direction and you will draw on your own for the remaining time.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is great as brian takes learning curve of a individual more than his/her sketching skills in consideration while giving your grades. In other words, even if your sketches are not at the top, you can still get a A range if you follows his feedbacks on your sketches and improving them by practicing a lot and show your efforts to brian.
reviews.comment_workload: High. In terms of a 1-credit course, although theres not solid assignments or exams, you would still want to finish the task and practice a lot.

reviews.author: Hou Liangheng
reviews.title: Maybe an important part in ISDN
reviews.comment_content:
In short, this is a sketch course. But technically, this is a design course. At first, you will learn from how to draw a line to how to draw a project and a person. Finally, you will learn how to design a project from your mind to reality.

I listed my own summary of the lecture:
1. Line
2. Lines of different depths and lengths
3. Circle and square
4. Cubes and spheres
5. Copy the product image with the cube
6. Design and draw your products
7. Hand
8. Body
Since this semester is related to ISDN2300, many of the sessions will be devoted to discussing your design.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Brian will tell you what to draw together, then give you time to contact each other and go through them one by one to tell you what the problem is. TA Natali will also help you.

When discussing the design for ISDN2300, Brian will ask you to show him your own work and express your own ideas one by one. Since everyone is just learning to sketch and can't draw very good, Brian will let you speak your mind and help you draw what you want to do.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is not bad, but very subjective.

Probably a lot of it is based on how well you draw, but is your design novel enough (that is, if Brian understands your design).

My grade is B+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is so heavy as a 1 credit course.

One assignment was to design 20 products, and each product required at least three views of the picture, a total of at least 60 pictures. Of course, I ended up submitting only 16 designs.

reviews.author: JackHack
reviews.title: Worth the credit so much
reviews.comment_content:
The course is designed for beginner.
You can learn a lot:
Drawing lines, shapes, object
Controlling strokes
Basic color theory
Rather complex objects and composition
Human steady/moving


If you have drawing skills before, and you are ISD student, then you don't have a choice to drop this required course. However, you can ask the professor for more challenging tasks and your grading

After attending the course, I can draw nicer, instead of scrappling randomly on paper.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was very good. Even though the course was conducted online, the prof will check and guide each one of us.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was based on your homework and final exam. I don't remember the exact ratiio.

Basically, the better you draw, the higher grading you will have. I can't draw very well but still managed to get a B.

The final exam was to design and draw certain adn tasks themes with 2(?) hours? Not too hard
reviews.comment_workload:
The most important thing is: it is only 1 credit, the work load is worth 5 credits.

ISD says they should have give it more credits, but they can't pack more content within 18 credits

reviews.author: Duallife
reviews.title: Nice but tired
reviews.comment_content:
Content is rich. But really a looooooot! i mean the prof is nice and teaches you many necessary things about sketching but it's really a big topic. Basically, you need to practice a lot to get an ok grade.
However, the lesson time is mainly the prof talk about sth, and you have 10-20 minutes of time of sketching yourself, then continue this loop for the whole lesson. So hard to judge whether it's useful or not.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brain is nice and patient. Like really nice, also do some interesting demo for us.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think is ok? but it heavily dependents on whether the students know to sketch beforehand. Finally get B+, from a beginner don't know shit, I think ok la...
However, I did learn a lot and see a lot of youtube tutorial off classes, so it did require a lot of time investment.
reviews.comment_workload: nothing to say, probably 10 credit course. U need to do assignment every week and all count as part of the final result. The few tedious one maybe something like draw 50 3d structure those kind of things, which takes a lot of time to do. For serious, I think it should be a 3 credit course at least.

reviews.author: Xxyz
reviews.title: very interesting course
reviews.comment_content: basically like taking drawing classes. you get to draw whatever you like and every week will be given a topic randomly.
reviews.comment_teaching: brian is a really kind teacher. he was very patient and willing to answer all kinds of questions. i once asked him about how to draw better circles or different shapes and he did provide some good suggestions that helped me a lot in sketching later on. according to his intro, he runs a design company and often needs to do quick sketches for his client during presentations so he's really good at sketching.
reviews.comment_grading: we only need to submit several sketches for him to grade but i think its based on his in-class observation instead of how well you actually draw. becuz i didnt think i draw nicely but still happened to get an A-
reviews.comment_workload: workload was not too heavy back then only need to keep drawing for almost 3 hrs every Wed morning

reviews.author: Aleco
reviews.title: If you have a sketching foundation, don't be afraid to take it.
reviews.comment_content: This is a drawing class. You will learn sketch and learn how to use different materials to draw. For example, Crayons, pencils, watercolors, and even correction fluid. If you have a background in sketching, this course will be quite easy for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brian is a good prof and will inspire you to create your own designs.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade of this course depends on how many pictures you finished. I only remember you need 10 pictures to get an A. Actually, you should draw one or two more pictures to ensure to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: If you want to get an A, to may spend a lot of time on this course. For me, I finished 12 sketches to get an A. The average time of one sketch is about 2-3 hours. If you only want an average grade, the workload is fine.
